            Facts
            
                
                    Large-leaved wood-aster is one of the earliest asters to bloom in Northeastern forests, but even when flowering stems are absent, large colonies of the distinctive four- to eight-inch wide basal leaves can be found. The tender young leaves may be cooked and eaten as greens.

                Forests
